alert.note: Alert for Kane (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 7:39PM MDT until August 18 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL KANE COUNTY... At 739 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the headwaters of Last Chance Creek. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding on Last Chance Creek. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Last Chance Creek to Lake Powell. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
